intro: Matthiola argentea, commonly known as silver stock, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and clusters of fragrant, four-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and pleasant scent. Matthiola argentea is also valued in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
